Topic.Title: Ryans Speech "attempt to set record for greatest number of blatant lies"

Message.Msg: "How is mitt going to create jobs. He has not mentioned one specific plan." Actually, he has mentioned more than one, many times. He won't have to do very much, though. Just instill the confidence in small businss owners that they will be able to make most of their own decisions and keep most of the their hard-earned money. No longer threatened with even higher taxes, the "wealthy" will again invest in our economy. (Tax loopholes for the rich should and will e removed) Put in simplest terms, R&R won't have to do too much. Remove many regulatory burdens (especially by the EPA), take advantage of our OWN natuiral resources while investing in credible, worthwhile alternative energy opportunities (when they become cost effective) and, most important, not be O and B. Voting these two back in is unquestionably the classic definition of insanity. Open your mind, let it, not MSNBC, do the common-sense thinking necessary to accomplish the most importnt goal: to lower our debt, create millions of new jobs, save the future of this country -- not to elect more Democrats out of habit or loyalty.

Message.Title: Ryan admits to lyin'...
Message.Msg: "I had a two hour and fifty-something" marathon, Ryan said last week an interview. But the Ryan campaign confirmed to Runner's World that he has only run one marathon, the 1990 Grandma’s Marathon in Duluth, Minnesota, which he finished in just over 4 hours. - Gee, only off by +25% What WON'T Ryan lie about!

Message.Title: Rmoney to hurricane victim who lost home - "go home, call 211"
Message.Msg: On Friday, Rmoney drove through a town that was flooded by Hurricane Isaac in part because it's still outside the vast flooding protection system built with federal funds after Hurricane Katrina devastated New Orleans. He talked with a local resident, Jodie Chiarello, 42, who lost her home in Isaac's flooding. Rmoney told her "go home and call 211." Chiarello said she will likely seek emergency shelter because her home was submerged in the flooding. She expressed frustration about the town's lack of flood protection and Rmoney's insensitivity and stupidity I can't go home you f-king #$%$ my house is underwater and the phone doesn't work...
If Obama ever ran a marathon the results would be sealed, and we would never be able to know anything about it.

And if Rmoney ever ran a marathon, he would not release his results (you people don't need to know) and keep his losing attempt sealed in a security box in a Cayman Island bank. The desparation of the low IQ anti-obama bigot and support of the windsock Willard and lyin' Ryan is enormous.

Message.Title: Obama, HUGE FLIP-FLOP
Message.Msg: Four years ago Candidate Obama was PRO-PEACE, let's get the troops out of the Mid-East, END THE WARS, bring them home. NOW, COMMANDER IN CHIEF OBAMA, 10 Years of WARS has made the U.S. STRONGER & MORE RESPECTED!!!!!! That is one huge FLIP FLOP http://www.whitehouse.gov/photos-and-video/video/2012/08/31/president-obama-speaks-troops-fort-bliss

You'll probably find that Obama never actually said he was pro-peace, he just allowed you to infer it from some deliberately vague remarks. The guy was a Rorschach. People projected on him what they wanted to see. I got wise to him in the summer of 2008 when he promised to filibuster the telecom immunity bill--and then turned right around and voted for it. There were at the time 50 pending lawsuits under which information about the depth and breadth of the illegal wiretapping would have been produced. The telecom immunity bill made all those lawsuits moot, and covered up Bush's wiretapping program. Obama showed right there that he was no friend to liberty and no friend of the Constitution.

Obama's answer is HOPE that the New Obama will be different from the Old Obama, and CHANGE from his failed policies to unstated new policies that will make everything different. Fool me once, shame on you.

Message.Title: I srael ENRAGED with General Dempsey
Message.Msg: I sraeli Vice PM: US ‘Undermining’ Push for Iran War Officials Slam Gen. Dempsey for Opposition to Attack by Jason Ditz, August 31, 2012 I sraeli officials are, as is so often the case these days, furious at the US for what they say is an attempt to undermine their push for a war against Iran, with a number of officials taking shots at Gen. Martin Dempsey for yesterday saying he did not want the US “complicit” in such an attack. The term “complicit” enraged a number of officials, who say that the word has “criminal connotations,” while Vice Premier Moshe Ya’alon bashed the US, accusing them of “undermining” the repeated I sraeli threats to attack. Ya’alon said he believed the US comments, which on occasion are less than enthusiastic endorsement for the attack on Iran, are “in part responsible” for Iran believing I srael’s threats are not credible, and also condemned UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon for visiting Iran to attend the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) summit in Tehran. I sraeli analysts predicted Dempsey’s comments might encourage I srael to attack unilaterally, by convincing them that the Obama Administration is unlikely to follow through on its own repeated threats to attack Iran. http://newsDOTantiwarDOTcom/2012/08/31/i sraeli-vice-pm-us-undermining-push-for-iran-war/ replace the 2 DOTs remove the space in i sraeli
The Whoppers weren't just being served by Burger King at the RNC this past week. Lyin Ryan delivered a few of his own (with extra cheese).
